## What is Open Science?


> *Transparent **and** accessible*

- Data
- Methodology
- Code
- Peer Review
- Paper Access

## Why do Open Science?

### Good for Science {{< fa flask >}} [(and Ornithology)]{.small .hl}

::::{.space-list}

:::{.fragment}
- Support science and research everywhere
  - [Small non-profits, labs/groups with less funding]{.hl}
:::

:::{.fragment}
- Science is more robust and reliable
  - [Complex analyses and best practices (e.g., genetics, eBird)]{.hl}
:::

:::{.fragment}
- Improves collegiality and collaboration
  - [Avian Conservation & international collaborations]{.hl}
:::

::::

## Why do Open Science?

### Good for You {{< fa lightbulb >}}
- Visibility, show your skills
- Get credit for *all* your work (SOPs, complex analyses)
- Portfolio pieces

<!-- - Often forces you to be a bit more organized -->

### You might have to {{< fa grin >}} 
- Required by granting agencies and government

# How do we *do* Open Science?

## Open Data, Methodology & Code

### 1. Get it online!  

- Post in a repository: **data, code, or catch-all**

:::{.fragment style="padding-bottom: 15px"}
### 2. Aim for long-term storage
:::


:::{.fragment}
### 3. Consider how you work
- Data and catch-all: {{< ai dryad >}} [Dryad](https://datadryad.org/), {{< ai figshare >}} [figshare](https://figshare.com), {{< ai zenodo >}} [Zenodo](https://zenodo.org/), etc.
- Project-based: {{< ai osf >}} [Open Science Framework](https://osf.io/) (OSF); [Quarto Manuscripts](https://quarto.org/docs/manuscripts/) on {{< fa brands github >}} [GitHub](https://github.com)
- Code-based: {{< fa brands github >}} [GitHub](https://github.com) (when paired with {{< ai zenodo >}} [Zenodo](https://zenodo.org/))

:::

## Platforms {visibility="hidden"}

:::{.spacer}
:::


Platform | Benefit
-------------- | ---- 
{{< ai dryad >}} [Dryad](https://datadryad.org/), {{< ai figshare >}} [figshare](https://figshare.com),<br>data or catch-all repositories | Straightforward & Findable [(well-known data repositories)]{.small}
{{< ai osf >}} [Open Science Framework](https://osf.io/) (OSF) | Findable & Good for collaborating on all project aspects[^1]
{{< fa brands github >}} [GitHub](https://github.com)  with {{< ai zenodo >}} [Zenodo](https://zenodo.org/)  | Sharing & Good for collaborating on code and data,<br>Zenodo ensures long term storage and Findability
{{< fa brands github >}} [GitHub](https://github.com) and code repositories | Sharing & Good for collaborating on code and data[^2]

: {tbl-colwidths="[40, 60]"}
 
[^1]: Connects to many different services like Dropbox, Figshare, GitHub, etc.
[^2]: Technically not guarenteed as long term storage

# Now for some tips...

# Tip 1

**Don't try to do everything**

## Tip 1: Don't try to do everything

> "Perfect is the enemy of good"
> -- Voltaire

- Be kind to yourself, don't expect perfection
- You're allowed to start small


![](figs/continuum.png){.absolute width=100% left=5% bottom=20% fig-alt="A fluffy white piping plover chick (shore bird) with an arrow leading to a white and grey adult piping plover. The words 'and grow!' are on the arrow"}

:::{.footer}
[Piping plover](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Piping_plover_(93872).jpg) and [chick](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Piping_plover_chick_(93850).jpg) - Rododendrites, CC BY-SA 4.0
:::

# Tip 2

**Do one new thing**

## Tip 2: Do one new thing

> *On every project, expand your skill set, just a little bit*

### A code example...

- 1<sup>st</sup> time - keep a script of your analysis
- 2<sup>nd</sup> time - share the script in a data repository
- 3<sup>rd</sup> time - share on GitHub (with the browser upload)
- 4<sup>th</sup> time - share on GitHub (with git!)

Next thing you know, you're sharing code *and* learning new tools

![](figs/procrastination.jpeg){.absolute right=0 bottom=0 fig-alt="cartoon with a chickadee. First panel chickadee says 'I better start building that nest', second panel says 'later', chickadee says 'shooot I have to get started', third panel says 'even later' chickadee says 'shoot!'"}

:::{.footnote}
[Birdstrips](https://www.patreon.com/c/birdstrips/about)
:::

# Tip 3

**It's okay to be nervous**

## Tip 3: It's okay to be nervous

> *and remember you're awesome!*

:::{.fragment}
### "What if I make a mistake?"
- Mistakes happen -> But you're being transparent!
:::

:::{.fragment}
### "What if someone steals my data/idea?"
- It's easier to make up data than to steal data
- You have a record!
:::


:::{.fragment}
**It's also okay to keep it private to start**
:::


![](figs/what_if.jpg){.absolute width=40% right=0 bottom=10% fig-alt="Cartoon with two boreal chickadees. First panel birds are eating seeds on the ground. One says 'What if it's rotten inside?' the other says 'It's not'. Second panel the birds are flying, one says 'What if we don't make it in time?' the other says 'We will.'. Third panel the birds are hanging off pinecones in a tree, one says 'What if I can't do it?', the other says 'You can'. Fourth panel the birds are facing the viewer, one says 'What if... everything's gonna be okay?', the other says 'It is'."}
